l1.name: Materials Management
l1.description: Procurement, inventory management and material valuation processes.

l2.name: Inventory Management
l2.description: Goods movements, stock monitoring, and physical inventory processes.

l3_list.name: Goods Receipt Processing
l3_list.description: Post incoming goods against purchase orders, production orders, or free delivery.

l4_list.description: Record arrival of goods, update stock quantities and trigger financial posting.
Receive goods not linked to a purchase order, e.g. samples or returns.
Reverse an incorrect goods receipt to correct inventory and accounting.

l3_list.name: Goods Issue Processing
l3_list.description: Manage outbound stock movements to cost centres, production, or scrapping.

l4_list.sub_process_name: Post goods issue to cost centre (MIGO — 201)
l4_list.description: Issue materials directly to an overhead cost centre for consumption.

l4_list.sub_process_name: Post goods issue for production order (MIGO — 261)
l4_list.description: Withdraw component materials from stock to supply a production order.

l4_list.sub_process_name: Post scrapping / goods issue for destruction (MIGO — 551)
l4_list.description: Write off obsolete or damaged stock and record consumption.
Move material within the same plant from one storage location to another.

l3_list.name: Physical Inventory and Stock Count
l3_list.description: Plan, execute, and reconcile cycle count and annual physical inventory.

l4_list.description: Generate the document that freezes book inventory at the count date.
Record the actual counted quantities against the frozen book stock.
Adjust book inventory to match counted quantities and update financials.
